text.author: Wikinews
text.title: FIFA World Cup 2018 day five: Sweden, Belgium, England win three points
text.summary1: (human1) On day 5 of the 2018 FIFA World Cup, Sweden defeated South Korea 1–0, Belgium defeated Panama 3–0 and Tunisia lost 1–2 to England, earning the winning teams three points each.
text.summary2: (claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) On day five of the 2018 FIFA World Cup, Sweden defeated South Korea 1-0 with a Granqvist penalty, Belgium beat Panama 3-0 with two Lukaku goals, and England secured a 2-1 victory over Tunisia thanks to Harry Kane's last-minute winner.
text.summary3: (gpt4o) On day five of the 2018 FIFA World Cup, Sweden beat South Korea 1-0 with Andreas Granqvist's penalty, Belgium defeated Panama 3-0 with goals from Dries Mertens and Romelu Lukaku (2), and England won 2-1 over Tunisia with a late goal by Harry Kane, as all three teams collected three points.
text.summary4: (Llama-3.2-3B-Instruct) The article reports on the results of the fifth day of the 2018 FIFA World Cup, with Sweden defeating South Korea 1-0, Belgium defeating Panama 3-0, and England winning 2-1 against Tunisia.
text.summary5: (Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) In the fifth day of the 2018 FIFA World Cup, Sweden beat South Korea 1-0, Belgium thrashed Panama 3-0, and England narrowly won against Tunisia 2-1.
